Authors:
Kanad Das, CHAKRABORTY Dyutiparna, K. P. Deepna Latha,
H.V.T. Cotter
Title:
Suillus lariciphilus K. Das, D. Chakr., K.P.D. Latha &
Cotter sp. nov.
Abstract:
Suillus lariciphilus collected from subalpine Himalayan
region of India and Nepal in association with Larix griffithiana and L.
himalaica is proposed here as a new species. It can be characterized as:
brown to gray-orange viscid pileus (that turning olive or bright green
then brown with KOH) with regular or irregularly interrupted velar
remnants at margin; brown-orange to gray-brown pore surface that becomes
blue-gray after bruising; reticulum on stipe surface above the
persistent annulus; context (in pileus) white that becoming yellowish
white or pale orange to darker after exposure when young but, brownish
when mature and mostly with pale lavender over the tubes, turning olive
brown to olive gray brown with FeSO4, light brown or pink orange with
KOH; brown spore print; basidiospores 7.812.5 × 3.55.0 µm; cystidia (in
tube) single on in clusters, mostly brown pigmented, nonencrusted;
ixocutis pattern of pileipellis; caulocystidia single or in clusters.
Detailed macro- and micromorphological features coupled with the
cultural behavior and illustrations are given. Its relation with the
allied taxa is discussed along with its placement in a phylogenetic
tree.
